intro: Gymnadenia tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Gymnadenia tenuiflora is often found in habitats with partial shade and is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
